title: Price Controls Set Off Heated Debate as History Gets a Second Look
summary: A discussion over whether price controls would work to stem inflation is sweeping progressives. So far, it has little political acceptance.

title: Energy Ended Up as a Good Bet Last Year. But Now What?
summary: Oil prices soared in 2021, giving a boost to the stocks of energy companies. But with the world shifting toward greener alternatives, don’t count on that trend continuing.

summary: OPEC Plus, the United States and others have been slow to ramp up output, lagging production goals.

summary: Companies are left on their own to set policy on vaccines for their employees. Oil production is only slowly ramping up. And this will be a messy tax season.

summary: For companies depending on fast, small deliveries, the costs of new Brexit trade rules are mounting.

summary: President López Obrador wants to halt most oil exports and imports of gasoline and other fuels. Critics say he is reneging on Mexico’s climate change commitments.

title: Exxon Sets a 2050 Goal for Net-Zero Greenhouse Gas Emissions
summary: The target does not account for the climate impact of its customers and suppliers, leaving the company lagging the commitments of some of its rivals.

title: Stocks drop as Treasury bond yields push higher.
summary: By Coral Murphy Marcos

title: Oil markets are expected to tighten as prices keep rising.
summary: The International Energy Agency said demand for oil this year was likely to be higher than expected. Prices are already nearing $90 a barrel.

summary: Stocks are off to their worst start of a year since 2016 as the central bank pulls back the enormous stimulus programs it began in the early months of the pandemic.

summary: The S&P 500 slid into correction territory before rallying, and signals on Wall Street show that investors have become markedly more pessimistic.

summary: Europe is a huge customer of Russia’s fossil fuels. Gas from the U.S. and elsewhere is helping offset fears of a midwinter cutoff.

summary: The company, the world’s largest maker of wind turbines, said pandemic delays in China and the rising cost of steel were hindering earnings.

summary: The S&P 500 rose 2.4 percent, its biggest one-day jump since June 2020. But some analysts cautioned against reading too much into a single day’s bounce.

title: Chevron has its best quarter since 2014, reflecting an oil industry turnaround.
summary: The company recorded a profit of $5.1 billion as global prices rose.

summary: The oil and gas giant said it would resume its stock buyback program by repurchasing $10 billion in shares over the next two years.

summary: Geopolitical tensions and a growing disparity between supply and demand have driven up prices. Here is what that means and what could happen next.

summary: High prices and strong demand would suggest it was time for a major increase, but uncertainty around Ukraine leaves the oil producers in an awkward spot.

title: Shell’s profit jumps, riding higher prices for oil and natural gas.
summary: Europe’s largest energy company said it would use some of the earnings to buy back more shares and increase its dividend.

title: British home energy prices are set to rise 54%.
summary: The jump in heat and electric bills, a result of the record rise in natural gas prices, will be “extremely worrying for many people,” a regulator said.

title: From Liverpool to London, Tighter Wallets and Colder Homes
summary: In Britain, prices are rising at the fastest pace in three decades. People on the lowest incomes are running out of ways to cut back, and the worst is yet to come.

summary: Investors took the strong jobs showing as a reason for the Federal Reserve to move quickly as it starts to raise interest rates this year.

summary: The stock market has begun swinging wildly as companies like Google, Facebook, Apple, Starbucks and Exxon Mobil reveal their earnings and hint at divergent prospects for the year ahead.

title: Why This Could Be a Critical Year for Electric Cars
summary: Booming in a depressed market, battery-powered vehicles are a plus for the climate but pose a big threat to carmakers and parts suppliers that are slow to change.

title: Kazakhstan Says Russian Troops Can Start Leaving This Week
summary: Kazakhstan’s president says violence has been quelled, so there is no longer need for the foreign troops he asked to help. Russia has not given a timeline for withdrawing.

summary: An explosion last summer in an Ontario community built on 19th-century gas wells has left locals searching for answers and some certainty that their town will ever recover.

summary: Facing a huge loss of revenue amid economic turmoil, the military has sent soldiers to act as debt collectors.

summary: Nursultan Nazarbayev, who had been absent during the recent unrest that gripped the country, said he supported the country’s leader and the economic reforms he has proposed.

summary: The billionaire former prime minister is working hard to persuade lawmakers to vote for him next week, despite an unusual résumé for a job resting on moral authority.

summary: After the president laid bare divisions over Russian meddling in Ukraine, his administration scrambled to get on the same page with European allies.

summary: Nursultan Nazarbayev, the autocratic former president, all but vanished after violent protests this month. But with his legacy so pervasive, will anything change?

summary: Lithuanian efforts to stop potash, a key fertilizer ingredient, from Belarus from crossing its territory to punish the country’s authoritarian leader may play into Russia’s hands.

summary: Since paying the price for annexing Crimea in 2014, Russia has tried to make its economy sanctions-proof, hoarding currency to insulate the country.

summary: Russia can seize control over Ukraine or keep strong economic ties to Europe. It will be hard to do both.

title: A Bellwether for Narendra Modi as India’s Largest State Goes to the Polls
summary: While many voters say they are concerned about the economy, the prime minister’s party has placed a focus on religion, with often polarizing effects.
